line: From the PFT Studios in still moderately charming and majestic downtown Danville, it's—
Yeah, yeah, we know the drill. We've hosted before. (pointing to Major Monogram) He's good, I'm evil, blah blah blah.
I, for one, am excited to be here.
I'm all tingly! I've actually got butterflies in my sto—

Let me finish my introduction! Welcome to Phineas and Ferb's Musical Cliptastic Countdown Hosted by...Kelly Osbourne! (Timpani drum plays as Doof and Monogram get questionable looks on their faces.) And now, here's our host: She's a singer, an actor, a fashionista du jour, Kelly Osbourne!

Hi, everybody! What'cha doin'? I have always wanted to say that. I am so excited to be here. I promise you guys, this is gonna be a rockin' show full of surprises. And anyone who knows anything about me, they know that I absolutely LOVE Phineas and Ferb! And being a singer myself, I love love LOVE the songs.
Wai-wai-wai-, w-what's goin' on here?! We are the hosts!
Yeah, and, uh, aren't you a little too three-dimensional to host an animated show, young lady?
Yes. Yes, I am. But I'm doing it anyway, so just deal with it.
But w-we have hosting contracts and everything!
Did you read your contract?

Nobody reads them, they're like a hundred pages long and pages 2 through 99 are useless, like, like parsley on a dinner plate. Nobody eats it. Y'know, if they're gonna put stuff on your plate that y-you're not gonna eat, why not make it something useful, like a-like a keychain or, or gold doubloons.
Dude, why are you rambling on about parsley? You're bringing the entire energy of the show down! Maybe you guys can be my co-hosts!
Co-hosts? I don't like the sound of that. Sounds like a demotion.
Enough of you two. (to the audience) You guys ready? Let's get this party started! (applause) There were so many songs to pick from, I mean, just take a look at all of them.
Wow, that is a lot of songs.
You guys voted and now we're gonna rock the top 10! Here's number 10!
Is this the Phineas and Ferb party?
Sure is.
Phineas and Ferb parties rule! (all cheering)

It's not their party, it's my party! And it's not a party, it's an intimate get together. (Shattering) (Gasps) What was that? Put that down, pardon me, use a napkin! What's my science teacher doing here?
I never miss a Phineas and Ferb party!
First of all, it's not a party, but if it were a party, it would not be their party, it would be MY PARTY!
♪ Candace party! Candace party! ♪
♪ It's not a party, it's an intimate get together! ♪
♪ Candace party! Candace party! ♪
♪ Don't call it that, it's just a get together! ♪
♪ Candace party! Candace party! ♪
♪ Don't spill your drink ♪
♪ It's not a party, it's an intimate get together ♪
♪ Candace party! Candace party! ♪
♪ Don't call it that, it's just a get together ♪
♪ Candace party! Candace party! ♪
Hi, Mom! What? WHAT?! I'm sorry, I can't hear you over Candace's intimate get together!
♪ Candace party! ♪
♪ Hey, what's this in this fishbowl? ♪
♪ It's not a party, it's an intimate get together! ♪
♪ Candace party! Candace party! ♪
♪ Don't call it that, it's just a get together! ♪
♪ Candace party! Candace party! ♪
♪ We're talking I to the N to the T-I-M-A-T-E get together! ♪
♪ Whaaaat? ♪
♪ I to the N to the T-I-M-A-T-E get together! ♪
♪ That's right! ♪
It's not a party...
(groans) Demoted to co-host.
I've been a co-host before and I had a blast doing it!
Well, goody gumdrops for you!
Don't worry, Kelly. I am totally down for being second banana.
Well, first of all, that's a little sad. But, second of all, technically, you would be third banana. It would go: Kelly, and then me, and then you. And, ih, I would be second banana.
Nobody is a banana, because there are no bananas!
Yes, we have no bananas!
Here's the song rolling in at number 9!
Excellent. From the top of this building, everyone in the Tri-State Area should be able to hear us.
♪ Perry, you know you are a boy's best friend ♪
♪ Yes, Perry ♪
♪ So come home, Perry ♪
Hey, Candace, why don't you sing one?
Um... ♪ Oh, Perry, I think its kinda scary ♪
Larry?
I ran out of rhymes, all right?
♪ She'll change her name to Larry! ♪
♪ Larry! ♪
♪ So, come home, Perry, ♪
Oh, there you are, Perry.
Perry!
(Comes and takes Candace's microphone) Good job, Larry.
Welcome home.
This is going to be a fantastic countdown! Um, just one thing, guys. We seriously have to do something about your...fashion. It's just not working.
Uh, really?
You look a bit, like, stiff and-and uniformy. Right, guys?
Uniformy? Is that even a word?
Yeah, "uniformy." If you look it up, there's a picture of you.
You're one to talk.
What?
I mean that whole laboratory look was was never in, I mean, even if you are an "evil scientist". You should try a cape.
A cape? Where am I gonna get a cape at this hour?
You could try a Nehru jacket.
Well, go and get changed then.
(leaving with Monogram) If I could get a Nehru jacket, I could get a cape.
(shakes head) Men. While my co-hosts go backstage and bring their fashions into this century, here's song 8.
♪ I can do it, I can run, I can hunt you down ♪
Okay, let's keep rocking and get rol—
(offscreen) Wa-wa-wait!
Yeah, hold the boat.
Mind you, this does not mean in any way, shape, or hair color, that I am your co-host. I-I'm just sayin'.
Wow! Now I know what I would look like if I had middle-aged male clones.
Oh, I can't believe I let myself get talked into this. It's embarrassing and, if I'm being honest, a bit drafty.
Ah, just go with it, Francis. (to Kelly) Hey, l-look at this! Strike a pose! Look, look, look, I'm vo—
Vogueing?! I love vogueing! It's so '90's!
I was a bit of a secret voguer myself.
Really?
It wasn't a secret.
You know what we should do then? Strike a pose.
Vogue. Vogueing. That's it. Look it up, kids. That's what the internet is for.
That was fun! Great idea, Kelly.
Thank you.

But, but, vogueing was my idea! I started to say "vogueing" and you just cut me off right before when I just got "vo" out. Y'know, I— (to Monogram) What did you think I was gonna say? Vociferous? What other words start with "vo"?
Give it a rest, Heinz. (to Kelly) He's always like this.
That's it! That is it! You will rue the day that you demoted Heinz Doofenshmirtz to co-host! (he leaves)
Hmm. You know what that means?
I think I do.
(singsongy) More hosting for us!
All right! Here's a little ditty I like to call "Song Number 7"!
♪ Through the eye of the needle ♪
♪ A-G-L-E-T ♪
♪ Get's us all up on our feet, yeah, yeah, yeah ♪
♪ A-G-L-E-T ♪
♪ We're gonna tie the world together (X4) ♪
(On P.A) Ladies and Gentlemen, my sister, Candace Flynn!
♪ And in the end of most important thing ♪
The... uh... Wait a minute! It doesn't matter! I can't believe I was almost sucked into this!
Are you guys having as much fun as I am? (crowd cheers)
Yes! Now that I'm back in my old clothes, uniformy or not. I predict the Nehru jacket will make a comeback.
Mmm. Not gonna happen.
Oh.
But you know what is gonna happen? Song number 6!
So Phineas, what do you think of the City of Love?
I wish it was the City of Airplane Parts.
Oh, you're just too stressed. You should take a moment to relax and enjoy it.
Huh. That awning could be used as a sail. Or, you know, a parachute. Depending on how things go.
♪ Take a break and smell these flowers ♪
I wonder if they still have pieces of that hanging around? The rivets would come in handy.
Oh, Phineas...
Hey, look at that nifty little blow torch!
♪ How perfect could this be ♪
♪ (In the City of Love) ♪
♪ In the City of Love ♪
♪ (In the City of Love) ♪
♪ We could try some fancy cheese ♪
I wonder if oil-based paint is combustible...as a rocket fuel.
♪ Isn't this a perfect day? ♪
Oh, that reminds me, we might need helmets!
♪ Oh, how can he not feel the same way ♪
♪ (In the City of Love) ♪
♪ In the City of Love ♪
♪ I wish that he would whisper "ma chérie, je t'aime" ♪
♪ (In the City of Love) ♪
♪ In the City of Love (in the City of Love) ♪
Hey you! Stop letting my balloons go!
Part II

Okay, little Miss Osbourne, (coming back onstage with an inator helmet on his head and a remote) prepare to say hello to your doom (Agent P appears on one of the rafters above the soundstage.) at the hands of—or, I guess in this case, in the head of—the man who is not your co-host! (Perry holds onto a rope with one hand and holds a mirror in the other.)
Wow. That was close.
Wait. Was that Perry the Platypus? Great. They're probably letting him host the show.
Everyone welcome Perry! (massive applause) Oh my gosh, this day just keeps getting better and better! You know, I was hoping you'd stop by. Do you...Do you want to introduce the next song?
Let me translate for you guys. What I believe he just said was, "Swinging in at number 5 is..."
Summer... It sounds dangerous, yet oddly compelling. What is it?
What is summer? Man, where do I begin?
♪ The days are longer, The nights are shorter, The sun is shining ♪
♪ It's noticeably warmer ♪
♪ Summer, every single moment is worth its weight in gold ♪
Oh, wait. Maybe we're going too fast.
♪ The nights are shorter ♪
♪ It's noticeably warmer ♪
♪ Summer, every single moment is worth its weight in gold ♪

That last song just makes me wanna move and groove, but enough about me. Because I have a surprise for everyone. (applause) A friend of mine wanted to stop by and say hi, so please, put your hands together and give a warm welcome to Maia Mitchell!
Hi! I was watching from backstage and I could not wait to get out here! I love all the songs so far!
I know, right? Aren't they fun?
Yeah, they're amazing! And, Kelly, you are doing an awesome job of hosting. Isn't she? (encourages applause) No, no, you're great! And, Major Monogram, I'm Maia. (shakes Monogram's hand)
Pleasure to meet you, young lady.
And Perry! I love you! You're my favorite, actually, because, we have something in common.
What's that?
We're both from Australia.
(gasp) Didn't even think of that. That's so cool!
That is so cool. (giggles)
Maia, why don't you introduce the next song?
I was actually waiting for you to ask me to do that.
Yes!
Check it out! It's number 4!
Do I know you?
Yeah, I'm you from another dimension.
Well that would explain the handsomeness.
Right back atcha, big guy.
Does that mean you and I are exactly alike?
I suppose so.
♪ Do you want some rice pudding? ♪
Blech, no, that's gross!
♪ It was a test. Almond brittle? ♪
♪ Ooh, I love it the most! ♪
Me too!
♪ Do you collect coins? ♪
♪ Yeah, just in case ♪
♪ Dominant race! ♪
But not the vending machine thing. That's gonna happen.
♪ But now before me I see ♪
♪ Someone with whom I agree ♪
♪ Hmm, I thought I'd be taller ♪
♪ I've been told I slouch ♪
It's in this pouch.
Ouch!
You know, I can't help but notice that your scar goes over your eyepatch.
Yeah...
...Nothing...
♪ Do llamas weird you out? ♪
♪ Yeah, are they camels or sheep? ♪
No, no, I meant Lorenzo.
Oh, that's right.
♪ He played Meap! ♪
♪ Ooh-wee-ooh ♪
♪ And now before me I see ♪
♪ That's right. ♪
♪ Twice the evil ♪
♪ Coming at you Fridays! ♪
What's that, are we doing a TV show together?
Oh no. It just sort of sounded like that. Well, I mean, we could. We should!
Hmm, maybe we're not so much alike
That can be your catchphrase! You're the grumpy one. (Pokes him) Eh?
There are so many great songs!
I know! What did you think about that last song, Perry?
I have a...I have a confession.
What's that?
I might, uh, make Perry noises when no one's looking.
(gasps) You're kidding! Me, too!
You do?
All the time!
Make that three!
Sir, I just wanted to check to see if you— (freaks out) MAIA MITCHELL!!! I'm your biggest fan! Love your voice and your work!
Thank you so much. You're really sweet.
Hey, you know what? I've got an idea. Why don't we all make Perry noises together?
Yeah!
You ready?
Yeah.
(to Monogram) You ready? (Monogram cracks his knuckles) Okay.
(laughs) Nobody does it better than Perry.
I'll never get tired of that.
Me neither.
Well, sadly, I have to go.
No! Really?
Yeah, but thank you so much for having me.
Thank you so much for stopping by!
(hugging Kelly) Of course, my pleasure. Heh!
Maia Mitchell, everyone!
(waves) Bye!
Hey, I'll walk you out!
(chuckles) Looks like someone's got a schoolboy crush.
You think? Anyway, let's get back to the countdown. Here's number 3.
(Chuckles while sweating) Who's up for charades?
Perry the Platypus, what are you doing down here?
Dad?
Oh, hi, Vanessa.
Dad, what are you doing?
♪ Well, I'll be honest, I don't really understand ♪
♪ Whaaat? ♪
♪ Records on my fingers ♪
♪ Don't stop ♪
♪ I can't stop, I got a platypus controlling me ♪
♪ Whaaat? ♪
♪ I got a platypus controlling me ♪
♪ Strange set of circumstances ♪
♪ I fell down the hill, I got glue on my hands, ♪
♪ Don't stop! Don't stop! ♪
♪ Well I would if I was able ♪
♪ There's a platypus controlling him- Whaaat? ♪
Oh I get it, platypus is a metaphor for whatever's keeping you down!
♪ Like corporations are a platypus ♪
My teacher is a panda
♪ Society's a platypus ♪
♪ Just me ♪
♪ We all got a platypus controlling us ♪
♪ I'd stop if I was able ♪
♪ We all got a platypus controlling us ♪
♪ I'm not speaking metaphorically ♪
Wait! Oh wait, no, he's gone! Hey!
(At Vanessa) Your dad's kinda cool.
You're my punk-rock boyfriend! You're not supposed to think my dad is cool! (She walks over to Doofenshmirtz) It only matters that I think he's cool. (Kisses him on the cheek)
She thinks I'm cool!
You know what'd be really cool? To write a song so next year the song can be on the countdown!
Well, as a fellow musician, I heartily agree.
Oh, you're a musician?
Well, yes. From, uh, from time to time, I like to strum the (speaks the Hawaiian pronunciation) ukulele.
Ah!
Uhhhh, did I miss Maia Mitchell?
I'm afraid so.
Ah, bummer. Anyway, as a musician, not as a co-host, mind you, I'd like to get in on this little songwriting thing you're about to do.
What do you play?
Oh, several things, by my instrument of choice is the kazoo.
You rock the kaz?
I do.
Fine! Let's start with the lyrics then. Maybe we can do some sort of a round robin kinda thing and write a line, and the next person can rhyme it.
Oh, good idea. Ahem. Me first, me first. Uh, let's see. "When I wake up in the morning sun..."
"I realize you're the only one."
Oh, now it's me. ♪ "And by the moon that's, oh, so silver." ♪
Dude, really?
What? What?
There's no rhyme for the word "silver".
She's right.
No, no, look...eh...uh..."Bilver" and, and, and there's (Kelly scoffs) What, what?
What is a bilver?
It's a...water moving thingy.
I believe what you're thinking of is a bilge pump.
Oh. I've always called it a bilver. Okay, how about this? ♪ "And by the moon that's oh, so, orange." ♪
Oy.
Is that better?
See how I just rolled my eyes? Please roll clip number 2!
♪ It's been a long, long day ♪
♪ That we'd ever reach the point ♪
♪ Now the sun has set on this, ♪
♪ As soon as you wake up you gotta make your move ♪
♪ Don't miss the beat, just get into the groove ♪
♪ The sun is shinin', there's a lot that you can do (a lot that you can do) ♪
All right, I'm taking a verse.
Be my guest!
♪ I traveled halfway 'round the world ♪
♪ (never been so proud) ♪
♪ I know at first it seemed implausible ♪
That's it!
♪ Life is full of music so you ought to dance ♪
She's got it!
♪ The world's a stage and it is time for your debut ♪
By Jove, I think she's got it!
♪ Don't waste a minute sitting on that chair ♪
Yeah!
♪ The world is callin' so, just get out there ♪
That's what I'm talking about!
♪ You can see forever so your dreams are all in view ♪
♪ Yes it's true ♪
♪ Summer belongs to you (summer belongs to you) ♪
♪ Summer belongs to you (summer belongs to you) ♪
Hey, Candace!
Jeremy! You came back early!
Well, I missed my girlfriend.
Oooh! I like the sound of that!
Besides you forgot something in France.
I did? What?
This.
♪ Baby, baby, baby, baby ♪
♪ Summer belongs to you (summer belongs to you) ♪
Part III
Right, guys, before we roll our last clip, I have to know something. Do you have a favorite song on the countdown?
Well, I'm, uh, I'm particularly partial to number three.
And I like number seven, that's my lucky number. (The background starts to ripple.) It all started when I was seven years old, back in Drusselstein—
W-W-Wait a minute. You're doing a flashback.
Well, yeah, it's kinda my thing. I do a lot of these (stammers)
Um, we can't fit that in.
Well, what if I make it short?

We still don't have time because...it's the moment we've all been waiting for!!! And I can't believe this, but you all picked my favorite song as the number one song! You guys have fabulous taste, I'm just saying. You guys ready? It's... Everything's Better with Perry!!!
Good morning, Perry! Now that's the way to wake up. (He hugs Perry) This is gonna be the best day ever.
Well, this has been the most amazing day! And to quote my favorites, Phineas and Ferb, "The best day ever!"
I completely concur.
Okay, okay, I've been reconsidering and I'm going to give in. I'm totally gonna be your co-host.
That's great. But—
So what are my co-hosting duties? What's next on the old co-hosting train I jumped aboard? What do I do?
Say goodbye, Dr. D.
That's it? Goodbye, Dr. D!
Goodbye.
Thank you so much, everybody, that was so much fun! I'm gonna be singing these songs all day! See ya next time!
